text: And also to meet some lovely new folks!
Belated thanks to all that organised @MeCCSA2015 for a great conference. Was great to catch up with folks.
@Emzamara Hope I can get home tomorrow!!!
@krawftwerk it went pretty well, cheers!
@krawftwerk you'd be surprised.
By 'watch' I mean view, engage with, etc.   Watch was a poor choice of words in hindsight. Still in TV Studies mode.
@krawftwerk damn, I see how that could be confusing. Bad word choice. Change watch to view.
Also good points about exercising ethical judgement when consuming certain media. But we shouldn't shy away either.
Point of the day courtesy of Karen Boyle. 'We need to watch the things we study'. Amazing that we still need to be reminded of this.
Spirited debate on pornography to start the 2nd day. Now for something a bit different, the future of the BBC. #meccsa2015
RT @miriamruthross: Prof Karen Boyle: burdened work culture of academia is sometimes self-perpetuating. time to think how we can change thi…
RT @aliciablumross: #meccsa2015 thought provoking talk by Karen Boyle on the culture of 'competitive busyness' in academia
Huge thanks to @RuthDeller for putting together an excellent soap panel. I think it went pretty well!
Made it to #meccsa2015 Looking forward to the opening plenary!
Thanks to this paper, my iPhoto gallery is now full of pictures of Ian Beale. #meccsa2015
RT @jegleggott: MeCCSA 2015 delegates:  hashtag is #meccsa2015
Don't get me wrong, Glasgow Uni looks glorious, but many of its facilities are outright medieval.
The venue for tomorrow's conference is straight up gorgeous. Coming from Glasgow it's nice to see something new for a change.
Really looking forward to presenting my paper on #EastEnders tomorrow at #meccsa2015 Lucy instead of Pat this time though.
In classic conference style I'm still writing my paper on the train. Hey, it's cutting edge stuff!
Been a while Twitter, but I'm on my way to #meccsa2015 so it's time to resurrect the old academic account. Newcastle here I come.
@Emzamara A great film! Though I might be alone in that opinion...
Great night at the 'unofficial' Screen dinner. Cheers to all involved, including @GlasgowsDA
Looking forward to the start of #ScreenConference today at @GlasgowUni
TV scholars of the world unite and embrace soap opera! Please, for the sake of the discipline!
Now that Baftss is over it's back to the thesis grind. Feeling inspired after the weekend though!
That's it for #baftss14 it's been great. Given me lots to think about. Back to Glasgow I go!
Richard Dyer's keynote could have done with paying some attention to TV, but I suppose I can let him off. Great stuff. #baftss14
Interesting reflection of how we view show runners as the absolute authority despite the highly collaborative nature of US TV. #baftss14
Mary Harrod's paper brought up interesting questions of how French cinephilia approaches TV. US 'quality' TV as haven for auteurs? #baftss14
By interesting I mean telling.
Interesting how TV is usually more of an afterthought in these debates on impact and engagement. #baftss14
Hugely enjoyable and enlightening panel on male stardom. A subject I know next to nothing about. #baftss14
RT @Dr_JLW: Incredibly interesting paper from Gabor Gergely on the enduring stardom of Hungarian Pal Javor #baftss14
Excellent screening of Riddles of the Sphinx with a Q&A from Laura Mulvey. #baftss14
The Noah hate is strong at #baftss14 As is the Whedon love. Standard stuff for film/TV studies.
@NickXHall really interesting paper. A nice hopeful outlook as well which is rare.
Looking forward to the Televisual Perspectives panel this morning. Sounds like 3 really interesting papers. #baftss14
RT @jegleggott: #baftss14  I'm frightened. http://t.co/wI4clrC2Zn
@cupofbeans @NickXHall Sorry about the spoilers! It's a minefield!
RT @cupofbeans: I've never been sorrier to be missing a conference MT “@NickXHall:  #baftss14 http://t.co/b1rVHynMN1
My new handle for my uni work. I promise it'll be just as entertaining!
